title: Stafford wins first MVP, says he'll return in '26
content: Rams QB Matthew Stafford edged Drake Maye in the closest MVP vote since 2003, then closed his acceptance speech by saying he'll return to play next season.

title: Brees, Fitzgerald make Hall of Fame in first year
content: The Pro Football Hall of Fame will welcome five into its 2026 class, including Drew Brees and Larry Fitzgerald -- who were in their first year of eligibility -- as well as Adam Vinatieri, Luke Kuechly and Roger Craig.

title: Garrett named DPOY; JSN wins offensive honors
content: Myles Garrett's record-breaking season earned him a unanimous selection as Defensive Player of the Year, while Jaxon Smith-Njigba narrowly won Offensive Player of the Year at Thursday's NFL Honors ceremony.

title: Doncic limps off in 1st half; MRI set on hamstring
content: Lakers star Luka Doncic limped off the court in the second quarter Thursday night against the Sixers and will undergo an MRI on his left hamstring Friday.

title: Jets DT Phillips: Glenn inherited 'cancerous' group
content: Jets DT Harrison Phillips said it has been difficult for the team to get over the franchise's losing culture, saying first-year coach Aaron Glenn inherited a "cancerous" group.

title: Dubs confident oft-injured Porzingis ready to play
content: The Warriors are unsure when the newly acquired Kristaps Porzingis will make his debut but did say the anticipation is the oft-injured big man would be back on the court soon.

title: Doc: Clase accused of rigged pitches in 48 games
content: Cleveland Guardians pitcher Emmanuel Clase is accused of throwing suspect pitches to benefit bettors in at least 48 games over two years, significantly more than was initially revealed by prosecutors, according to a court document.

title: Trump signs law that withholds U.S. WADA dues
content: A provision for the U.S. to withhold its annual dues to WADA is now law until the organization takes steps to address the country's accusations that it's beholden to Chinese influence.

title: ü•á Faces of the Games: U.S. Olympians to watch

content: Multiple sportsbooks have reported taking MVP wagers on long shots, including a variety of Seahawks defenders.

title: Wrexham have Premier League in sight, just five years after Reynolds and Mac takeover
content: Feb. 9 marks five years since Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac completed their Wrexham takeover and already, they're on track for promotion to the Premier League.

title: From AD and Harden to Zubac and Vucevic: Fantasy reaction to the latest NBA trades
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to Thursday's NBA trade deadline.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona to activate Rashford clause for permanent deal

title: T.N.‚Äôs DPH, Animal Husbandry dept. issue advisories after avian influenza detection in crow samples
content: The advisory from the DPH reiterates that avian influenza is a viral disease that spreads from an infected bird to other birds, and that transmission to humans is rare

title: Moolampilly Day: 41 lost lives and 18 years later, justice remains a distant dream for evictees
content: Of the 316 displaced families, 41 evictees have died without receiving the support they were promised, while the Moolampilly Package Monitoring Committee has not convened in nearly six months.

title: Railways' financial health improves in last 10 years, surplus revenue after meeting cost: Vaishnaw
content: The Union Railways Minister said the Prime Minister's decision to achieve complete electrification of the railway network has led to reduction in the energy cost besides providing immense environmental benefits.

In stark contrast, the State‚Äôs luxury caravan tourism, despite government subsidies aimed at boosting investment, has struggled to gain traction, with only 13 operational caravans and two caravan parks in service.

title: Tiger tale: Life in the territory of fear in Andhra Pradesh
content: The ongoing human-animal conflict in Andhra Pradesh, where a sub-adult male tiger killed 20 heads of cattle in East Godavari and Eluru districts, has upended the livelihoods of many tobacco growers, dairy farmers and agricultural workers. content: Visakhapatnam will host a slate of major maritime events in February, bringing global navies to India‚Äôs east coast

content: While slamming the NDA government in Bihar under Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi Yadav charged that it was running on ‚Äúfalse praise and complete negligence‚Äù

title: The Lighthouse Bar opens at The Park Visakhapatnam
content: The Lighthouse Bar at The Park returns to a familiar address in the city with quiet confidence and sharp flavours

title: Migrant hands rooted across Telangana‚Äôs farms
content: From grape farms on Hyderabad‚Äôs fringes to paddy fields deep in the countryside, Telangana‚Äôs agriculture is being sustained by workers from other States. Farmers, activists and government officials say the migrants have become indispensable to farm operations here even as local youth step away from fieldwork. K. Shiva Shanker¬†traces the forces reshaping farm labour in the State

title: Classic case of consensual relationship turning acrimonious: Supreme Court quashes FIR alleging rape
content: The bench delivered its verdict on an appeal challenging a March last year order of the Chhattisgarh High Court that had refused to quash the proceedings arising out of the FIR registered in Bilaspur district in February 2025

content: Instead of maintaining the ESZ whose main objective is to function as a buffer for protected areas, successive governments have worked at reducing the ESZ around the Bannerghatta National Park in south Bengaluru. Hemanth C.S. looks at the implications

title: Loud music may damage your hearing before you realise it
content: Research has shown that prolonged exposure to loud noise can damage synapses without affecting the hearing threshold; since clinical assessments bank on this threshold, a normal audiogram need not mean no hearing damage

title: Death by cyberchondria
content: Filicide by a mother of two in Rajasthan‚Äôs Bhilwara district has shown the extremes to which health misinformation amplified by social media algorithms can lead in a country especially vulnerable to spurious medical advice

title: ED arrests former Resolution Professional of Richa Industries Limited
content: The accused, identified as Arvind Kumar, worked the company‚Äôs Resolution Professional from December 2018 to June 2025

title: Rediscovering the virtues of bamboo, an ancient plant
content: Bamboo trees across the country are best planted and grown in tropical and humid conditions, with good sunlight exposure and soil rich in organic matter

title: Odisha proposes changes to English spelling of six districts
content: Spellings of Deogarh, Khordha, Balasore, Kendrapara, Keonjhar and Nayagarh districts are likely to be changed to Debagarh, Khoradha, Baleshwar, Kendrapada, Kendujhar and Nayagada

title: Haryana MBBS students in dilemma over government‚Äôs bond policy; seek clarity on various aspects before consent
content: The policy to incentivise doctors to opt for government service upon completion of MBBS degree from government and government-aided medical colleges in Haryana was notified in 2022 and is applicable from academic session 2020-21 onwards

title: Documents on anti-Hindi agitation wiped out on order by Tamil Nadu‚Äôs last Congress CM Bhaktavatsalam
content: On February 24, 1967, a month before losing power to the¬†DMK, the last Congress Chief Minister ordered the Public Department to destroy records¬†on the anti-Hindi agitation that rocked the State. After assuming office,¬†Annadurai¬†sought an explanation from the Chief Secretary and wanted to know whether the papers could be reconstructed.

title: How Tamil Nadu‚Äôs two-language policy impacted the teachers of other languages in 1968
content: On January 23, 1968, the first¬†DMK¬†government, headed by¬†C.N.¬†Annadurai, adopted a resolution in the Madras Assembly scrapping the three-language formula¬†and mandating the teaching of only Tamil and English. The immediate switchover affected over 4,000 Hindi and Sanskrit teachers at about 2,400 schools in the State

title: Several people arrested, detained at liquor party near Ahmedabad
content: The action followed a raid conducted shortly after midnight at Safal Nirvana Greens near Sanand, where a Mumbai-based man had organised a party to mark his brother-in-law‚Äôs 25th wedding anniversary, officials said

title: 'Blew himself up after being stopped at gate': What we know about Pakistan suicide bomb blast
content: A devastating suicide bombing at a Shia mosque in Islamabad, Pakistan, claimed at least 31 lives and injured over 160 during Friday prayers. The attacker detonated himself after being stopped at the imambargah's gate. Authorities are investigating the incident, with initial reports suggesting foreign links. This attack follows recent violence in the region.

title: Delhi govt suspends 3 engineers after motorcyclist's accident - top developments
content: Three Delhi Jal Board engineers were suspended after a 25-year-old motorcyclist died falling into an unbarricaded construction pit. The victim's family alleged gross carelessness by the police in their search efforts, claiming they received no timely assistance. Authorities are investigating the incident and safety protocols.

title: 'Ghee made from bathroom-cleaning chemicals': Naidu slams previous Jagan govt over Tirupati laddus
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu alleged that the previous YSRCP government used ghee adulterated with "bathroom-cleaning chemicals" in the preparation of Tirupati laddus. He claimed this practice, which allegedly lasted for nearly five years, undermined the sanctity of the Tirumala temple and also affected the Srisailam temple.

title: Tim Cook on who will be next Apple CEO: I am obsessed with this, who‚Äôs in the room...
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook revealed his intense focus on succession planning, admitting he's "obsessed" with identifying future leaders. This comes amid recent senior executive retirements, which Cook described as "carefully orchestrated." While hardware chief John Ternus is reportedly a frontrunner, Cook also addressed AI's potential and Apple's upcoming 50th anniversary.

title: ‚ÄòCannot force to continue pregnancy‚Äô: SC allows abortion of 30-week pregnant minor ‚Äî why it matters
content: The Supreme Court has permitted a 17-year-old to terminate her 30-week pregnancy, emphasizing a minor's right to decide against continuing a pregnancy. Justices Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan directed JJ Hospital to proceed with the termination, prioritizing the girl's reproductive autonomy and her clear unwillingness to carry the pregnancy to term.

title: Malayalam actor accused of hit-and-run outside Trivandrum club; 2 bikers injured
content: A car, reportedly driven by actor Maniyanpilla Raju, allegedly struck a motorcycle and fled the scene after exiting the Trivandrum Club late Thursday. Two individuals on the two-wheeler sustained injuries and were hospitalized. The actor has reportedly pledged to cooperate with investigators and appear on Friday morning.

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown. Despite a significant selloff in software stocks triggered by Anthropic's legal AI tools, they argue AI will enhance, not replace, existing software, enabling greater productivity and innovation.

title: T20 World Cup: Siraj to join India T20I squad in Mumbai today; Rana all but ruled out
content: Mohammed Siraj is all set to fly to Mumbai today to link up with T20I squad before India‚Äôs World Cup opener vs USA.

title: Injury blow for India! Harshit Rana all but ruled out; Surya says 'he doesn‚Äôt look good'
content: India's T20 World Cup 2026 hopes for fast bowler Harshit Rana are uncertain after he sustained a knee injury during a warm-up match against South Africa. Captain Suryakumar Yadav acknowledged the situation is concerning, stating Rana hasn't been ruled out but the team is prepared to explore alternatives.  Squad balance and available bowling options will guide any replacement decisions.

title: Consensual sexual acts within marriage don‚Äôt attract Section 377: Delhi HC
content: The case started after the wife lodged a complaint claiming acts of cruelty and sexual offences after getting married to the petitioner in February 2022.

title: ‚ÄòIn 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be ‚Ä¶‚Äô: Musk makes a bold prediction
content: Elon Musk predicts space will soon host the most cost-effective AI data centers, potentially within three years. He highlighted space's superior solar energy capture, lack of atmospheric interference, and absence of day-night cycles, eliminating the need for batteries. Musk also downplayed concerns about GPU reliability in large-scale AI training, suggesting they become dependable after initial debugging.

title: 'People laughed and made fun of me,' 19-year-old farmer shares how he fought odds to become model
content: Hailing from Aligarh, Nitin Kumar defied village expectations to pursue a modeling dream. Facing ridicule and financial hardship, he juggled multiple jobs, from security guard to airport worker, to fund his aspirations. Through relentless practice and social media vlogs, Nitin eventually landed his first paid shows, proving that perseverance can overcome humble beginnings and societal doubts.

title: Noida techie death case: Allahabad HC orders immediate release of builder Abhay Kumar
content: The Allahabad High Court ordered the immediate release of Abhay Kumar, director of MZ Wiztown Planners, finding his arrest in a techie's death case illegal. The court cited the police's failure to follow mandatory arrest procedures, including informing the accused of reasons and providing a copy of the memo. Judicial remand orders were quashed.

title: No funds from the Centre? Pay teachers anyway: Supreme Court‚Äôs message to states
content: The Supreme Court has told states they cannot cite delays in central funding to underpay or withhold honorarium for RTE-linked instructors. Invoking Section 7(5) of the RTE Act, the court said the state must pay first and recover later. Uttar Pradesh has been directed to pay Rs 17,000 per month from 2017‚Äì18, begin payments from April 1, 2026, and clear arrears within six months.

title: From betrayal to second chances: How Dinesh Karthik found love again with Dipika Pallikal
content: Cricketer Dinesh Karthik faced immense personal turmoil when his childhood sweetheart and wife, Nikita, had an affair with his close friend and teammate, Murali Vijay. This devastating betrayal led to divorce and a period of depression for Karthik. However, he found love again with squash player Dipika Pallikal, rebuilding his life and career, eventually welcoming twins and retiring from cricket.

title: 'Readiness to defend against any adventurism': Ahead of US talks, Iran issues big warning
content: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi warned of defending against US "adventurism" ahead of Oman-mediated talks. He emphasized diplomacy for national interests, stating Iran is ready to protect its sovereignty. The discussions aim to address Tehran's nuclear program, with both nations holding differing views on past events and future commitments.

title: Black hoodie, scooter and Thar: CCTV captures fatal shooting of AAP leader outside gurdwara
content: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) functionary Lucky Oberoi was fatally shot outside a Jalandhar gurdwara by a masked assailant. CCTV footage captured the masked man firing multiple shots at close range before fleeing on a scooter with an accomplice. Oberoi, a financier and property dealer, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital.

title: T20 World Cup | 'Role models don't do this' - Agha on India not touring Pak, handshake row
content: Pakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha criticised India's decision not to shake hands during the Asia Cup and for not travelling to the neighbours for the 2025 Champions Trophy. Ahead of the T20 World Cup, Pakistan's government announced a boycott of their group stage match against India, citing solidarity with Bangladesh. Agha emphasised the importance of sportsmanship for young fans.

title: Vascular surgeon recommends simple morning routine to lower blood pressure
content: A vascular surgeon highlights the critical role of the first 30 minutes after waking in combating India's silent cardiovascular epidemic. Simple morning habits like mindful breathing, hydration, gentle movement, a short walk, and a balanced breakfast can significantly support vascular health and reduce long-term heart disease risk, especially for those over 35.

title: FIR filed in Lucknow against ‚ÄòGhooskhor Pandat‚Äô director for hurting religious sentiments
content: An FIR has been filed against the director and team of the film 'Ghooskhor Pandat' in Lucknow for allegedly hurting caste sentiments and disturbing social harmony. Police stated the film's title and content appear to deliberately target a specific caste, potentially inciting animosity and public unrest. Strict legal action is promised against those found guilty of promoting enmity.

title: SSC exam schedule 2026 Havaldar, MTS, and GD Constable released: Check details here
content: The Staff Selection Commission has released the SSC exam schedule 2026, confirming dates for MTS, Havaldar and GD Constable recruitments. The MTS and Havaldar exams will begin from February 4, with self-slotting opening January 15. GD Constable tests are tentatively set from February 23. Candidates are advised to track official updates regularly.

title: 'Paid promotion': Delhi Police reacts to 'hype around surge in missing girls'
content: Delhi Police refuted claims of a surge in missing girls and children, attributing the narrative to paid promotions and warning of legal action. Official data indicates a stable trend with a marginal decline in missing-person cases over the past decade, highlighting a high recovery rate.

title: Nipah cases in India: Experts explain the sneaky symptoms, and deadly risks we are not aware of
content: Two Nipah virus cases were identified in India, prompting nationwide surveillance. Over 190 contacts were tested, all returning negative results. Experts emphasize distinguishing facts from fears, highlighting the virus's zoonotic transmission from fruit bats and limited human-to-human spread through bodily fluids. Early symptoms are mild and non-specific, making diagnosis challenging.

title: ‚ÄòPlayed through flu & fever‚Äô: Coach reveals after Mandhana leads RCB to WPL glory
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru clinched their second WPL title with a stunning chase, powered by captain Smriti Mandhana's incredible 87.  Despite battling a severe flu and high fever, Mandhana's match-winning knock, alongside Georgia Voll's 79, guided RCB to a record-breaking 204-run victory over Delhi Capitals. Coach Malolan Rangarajan lauded her exceptional performance and leadership.

title: What really happened between Jim Bent & Jeffree Star? Controversy resurfaces during Beast Games run
content: Jim Bent‚Äôs strong run on Beast Games Season 2 brought renewed attention to old rumors linking him to Jeffree Star. Bent denied any relationship, calling it a past friendship. Star pushed back publicly, saying otherwise. Their exchange went viral, pulling the show into online debate while Bent continues competing for the $5 million prize.

title: Raghuvanshi honeymoon murder rerun? How bride plotted husband‚Äôs ambush with lover during stroll
content: A routine evening walk turned fatal for Ashish Kumar in Rajasthan, allegedly orchestrated by his wife, Anjali, and her long-time boyfriend. Police claim Anjali signaled her boyfriend and his friends to ambush Ashish, staging it as a robbery. Investigators uncovered a six-year relationship and a plot hatched just weeks prior, leading to the arrests of all four accused.

title: T20 World Cup: Shivam Dube‚Äîa gladiator with a bat in his hands
content: Shivam Dube‚Äôs role is probably India‚Äôs first true specialist in T20 cricket, someone whose primary job is to dismantle spinners in the middle overs. So far, he has performed that role to perfection, and not just against spin; he is now pulling fast bowlers into the stands as well. He has worked tirelessly on his bowling and has also fixed his issues against short-pitched deliveries.

title: Rajpal Yadav surrenders at Tihar Jail after Delhi High Court denies relief
content: Bollywood actor Rajpal Naurang Yadav on Thursday surrendered before the Tihar Jail authorities after the Delhi High Court refused to extend the deadline granted to him in connection with his conviction in multiple cheque dishonour cases.

title: Repo rate stays at 5.25%: GDP and inflation outlook explained ‚Äì what it means for your EMIs
content: What does the RBI monetary policy say on India‚Äôs GDP growth and inflation outlook? What does the decision to keep repo rate at 5.25% mean for your loan EMIs, fixed deposit and mutual fund investments? We take a look:

title: Setback for actor Vijay: Madras HC bins TVK chief's plea challenging Rs 1.5cr penalty by I-T dept
content: Madras High Court has dismissed actor Vijay's plea challenging a Rs 1.5 crore penalty imposed by the income tax department. The department claimed Vijay failed to disclose Rs 15 crore income from the movie 'Puli' during the 2015-16 assessment period. The court concurred with the department's submissions, upholding the penalty.

title: NFL Honors Awards 2026: List of winners as Patriots and Rams lead the spotlight
content: The NFL Honors Awards 2026 celebrated the league‚Äôs top performers ahead of Super Bowl LX. Matthew Stafford won MVP after a career-best season, while Myles Garrett claimed Defensive Player of the Year with a record-breaking sack total. Christian McCaffrey earned Comeback Player honors, Mike Vrabel was named Coach of the Year, and standout rookies also took center stage.

title: After Noida techie tragedy, Delhi biker dies after falling into pit
content: A 25-year-old man died in Janakpuri, Delhi, after his motorcycle plunged into an open construction pit. His family faced a night of searching multiple police stations before being informed of his death. The accident occurred on Joginder Singh Marg. The area reportedly lacked safety measures. An investigation is underway to determine responsibility for the fatal incident.

title: Pariksha Pe Charcha: PM Modi urges students to focus on skills‚Äîtop quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged with students nationwide in the 9th Pariksha Pe Charcha, offering guidance on exams, personal growth, and nation-building. He emphasized the importance of dreams, action, balance in life, and the equal significance of life and professional skills, urging students to avoid treating education as a burden and focus on holistic development.

title: Big jolt for Australia! Pace spearhead ruled out of T20 World Cup
content: Australia's T20 World Cup campaign faces a significant blow as veteran pacer Josh Hazlewood is ruled out due to a hamstring injury. This marks the first World Cup since 2011 without the famed "Big Three" quicks. Captain Mitch Marsh, despite depleted pace stocks, expresses confidence in the squad's depth and hints at a spin-focused approach for the upcoming tournament.

title: Can ‚ÄòSKY‚Äô emulate Hitman ‚Äî will India miss Rohit Sharma‚Äôs calm at the T20 World Cup?
content: Rohit Sharma, T20 World Cup ambassador and 2024 champion captain, will be honored before India's opener. Former coach Paras Mhambrey highlights Rohit's invaluable leadership, especially his 'bowler's captain' approach and calm demeanor, crucial for the team's success. The data-driven think-tank under Rohit and Dravid is also noted.

title: Ghaziabad suicides: Dad deleted girls‚Äô YouTube channel over 'Korea obsession' ‚Äî what autopsy reveals
content: Three sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, tragically died by suicide in Ghaziabad after their father objected to their deep fascination with Korean culture and K-dramas. Their YouTube channel, dedicated to this passion, was deleted shortly before their deaths. The girls, who had become increasingly isolated, reportedly lived in a fantasy world, dreaming of visiting Korea.

title: Taylor Swift announces ‚ÄòOpalite‚Äô music video
content: Excitement is in the air as Taylor Swift gears up to unveil her stunning music video for 'Opalite,' a highlight from her recent album 'The Life of a Showgirl.' Tune in on February 6th at 6:30 PM IST to catch the exclusive premiere on Spotify Premium and Apple Music, before it hits YouTube two days later.

title: Tamil Nadu elections: How BJP plans to do a Bihar in state and will it be enough?
content: The BJP is attempting to replicate its Bihar electoral strategy in Tamil Nadu by consolidating opposition forces and forming a broad social alliance across major caste segments. Aiming to counter the DMK, the party is forging alliances with former partners and breakaway factions, including the AIADMK and PMK, to build a wider NDA for the upcoming assembly elections.

title: When Time Bends For Money: Panchayat Claims Bills From The Future
content: When it comes to corruption, or alleged corruption, time is fluid - there is no future, no past, and the present is what you want it to be.

title: 30 Killed, 130 Injured In Suicide Bombing At Shrine In Islamabad
content: At least 30 people were killed and many were injured after a suicide bomber detonated himself inside a shrine in Pakistan's capital, Islamabad. The explosion occurred at Tarlai Imambargah, situated in the Shehzad Town area of the city.

title: Darjeeling Toy Train Service Hits Record Revenue Of Rs 24.6 Crore In 2025
content: The Darjeeling Himalayan Railway (DHR) toy train service is one of the most popular tourist attractions in West Bengal.

title: Israeli Spy Chief's Brother Smuggled Cigarettes Into Gaza, Earned Rs 1 Crore
content: Israeli authorities have arrested Bezalel Zini, the brother of David Zini, director of Israel's domestic intelligence agency Shin Bet, on suspicion of smuggling illegal goods worth tens of thousands of dollars into the Gaza Strip since the war began.

title: Fact-Check: Viral Photos Of Mira Nair And Zohran Mamdani With Epstein Are Fake
content: A day after a fresh batch of documents related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein were released, fake images claiming to show the convicted sex offender with Indian filmmaker Mira Nair and a young Zohran Mamdani surface online.

title: Pakistan, Fed Up With Manhole Cover Thefts, Announces Big Fine And Jail
content: In cash-strapped Pakistan, the punishment for the theft of a manhole cover could be 10 years in prison and a fine of up to 50 lakh Pakistani rupees.

title: Crores In Cash Seized In Raids Linked To Arunachal Highway Compensation Scam
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has carried out search operations at multiple locations in Arunachal Pradesh in connection with the Trans-Arunachal Highway land compensation scam.

title: 14 New Self-Bag Drop Counters Go Live At Mumbai Airport
content: The "airport sprint" might finally be over. In a major move to eliminate terminal bottlenecks, Mumbai Airport has inaugurated 14 cutting-edge hybrid self-bag drop counters at Terminal 2.

title: 3 Arrested In Karnataka For Allegedly Blackmailing Man Over Private Videos
content: Three people have been arrested in Karnataka's Belagavi for allegedly blackmailing a man by secretly recording his private moments and threatening to circulate the videos on social media and news channels unless he paid Rs 50 lakh.

title: Trump Aide's Jet Used By ICE To Deport Palestinians To West Bank: Report
content: A private jet owned by a close associate of US President Donald Trump was used by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to deport Palestinian detainees to the West Bank, according to an investigation by The Guardian.

title: Bangladesh Election 2026: The Rise And Fall Of Sheikh Hasina's Awami League
content: Bangladesh Election 2026: Bangladesh is set to vote in its general elections on February 12, its first since the ouster of the former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina-led Awami League government.

title: Rs 2.5 Lakh A Minute, Up To Rs 57 Crore: Cost Of Parliament Disruptions
content: Rs 2.5 lakh a minute, Rs 1.5 crore per hour, Rs 9 crore per day and up to Rs 57 crore of taxpayers' money is approximately how much the disruptions during the Parliament's Budget Session have cost so far.

title: Indian Army Launches 'Friends For Life' Platform To Boost Military Ties With 99 Nations
content: Chief of Army Staff General Upendra Dwivedi on Thursday launched a website titled 'Friends for Life', aimed at strengthening professional engagement and enduring bonds among military officers from India and friendly foreign countries.

title: Delhi Biker Falls To Death In Pool-Sized Pit Dug Up On Road By Jal Board
content: A biker died after he fell into a pit in Delhi's Janakpuri today. In photos that are viral on social media, the man's body can be seen lying next to his Apache RTR 200 bike at the bottom of the pit. The man was wearing a helm

title: In Wargame Simulation, Russia Invades A European Country. Then This Happens
content: European governments are stepping up military planning amid rising fears that Russia may move against NATO or European Union countries sooner than expected. Europe may not be fully prepared to respond to such a threat, a recent wargame has revealed.

title: Top Russian Military Intelligence Officer Riddled With Bullets In Moscow
content: A high-profile general in Russia's military was reportedly wounded after being shot several times in Moscow.

title: Newly Discovered Comet May Become Visible In Daylight This April
content: A newly discovered comet has astronomers excited, with the potential to be a spectacular sight in early April. C/2026 A1 (MAPS) was spotted by a team of four amateur astronomers with a remotely operated telescope in the Atacama desert on January 13.

title: Comedian Kunal Kamra Approaches High Court Against 'Sahyog' Portal
content: Stand-up comedian and political satirist Kunal Kamra has approached the Bombay High Court challenging the constitutional validity of the Sahyog Portal.

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 5 Live Updates: Lok Sabha Adjourned Till Monday Amid Opposition Protests
content: Parliament Budget Session Day 5 Live Updates: The Lok Sabha resumedamid protests and sloganeering, leading to the House being adjourned till Monday

title: Amazon To Invest $200 Billion In AI After Washington Post Announces Layoffs
content: Amazon will spend $200 billion in 2026, over 50 per cent higher than last year, ramping up investment in artificial intelligence and robotics, the tech giant said.

title: Re-ranking the Premier League: Who's up? Who's down?
content: Oliver Glasner was named manager of the month for september . he will be followed up by Enzo Maresca, whose Chelsea won three and drew one in November . Glasner has publicly stated that he'll be leaving his club . click here for all the latest transfer news .

title: 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame: Meet the new members
content: quarterback Drew Brees is one of two quarterbacks to throw for more than 80,000 yards . wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald will also be in the 2026 Hall class . he finished second only to Hall of Famer Jerry Rice in career receptions .

title: 2026 NFL Honors: Who won the league's biggest awards?
content: the best of the NFL gathered at the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco for Thursday's Super Bowl honors . the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots meet at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California, for super bowl lX . quarterback Matthew Stafford won the biggest prize -- MVP .

title: Men's Power Rankings: A static top 5 (for now), but big rises (Kansas) and drops (Gonzaga, BYU) elsewhere
content: the top of the men's college basketball Power Rankings has remained pretty stagnant for weeks now . even Illinois, the newest member of the top five, is riding a 12-game winning streak and hasn't lost since Dec. 13 . before the next edition of the rankings, four of our top-five teams have road games against other top-25 teams .

title: Nine NBA trade season questions: What's next for Giannis? Did the Lakers improve?
content: the 2026 trade deadline is officially over, and a flurry of deals has shaken up both conferences with just a few months left in the regular season . the lakers were on the move this week, with James Harden heading to the Cleveland Cavaliers in exchange for darius Garland .

title: Who makes Mike Macdonald's defense so good? Seahawks to watch in Super Bowl LX
content: the seahawks are on a more impressive Super Bowl run than the Patriots . the Seahawks have held opponents to 10 points or fewer five times . it's the biggest reason the Seattles won a club-record 14 games during the regular season .

title: NHL trade grades: Who comes out ahead in Artemi Panarin trade?
content: the 2025-26 NHL trade season is off to a busy start . the Vancouver Canucks traded defenseman Rasmus Andersson to the Vegas Golden Knights . earlier, the Pittsburgh Penguins sent goaltender Tristan Jarry and forward Sam Poulin to the Edmonton Oilers .

title: Ranking the top 10 prospects in all 30 MLB farm systems
content: the top 10 prospects for all 30 major league farm systems are listed below . players in the big leagues are eligible for this update as MLB rookie eligibility rules apply here . there are 130 at-bats, 50 innings pitched or 45 days on the active roster .
